sourceMeaningMnemonic: You see <radical>twenty</radical> <radical>slide</radical>s lined up like a <kanji>grid</kanji>. You don't know who put them here, but they almost look like the grid paper you do your maths homework in. But who would use a slide as grid paper?
meaningInfo: Picture twenty slides laid out in a grid system.
readingMnemonic: As you stare at the slide <kanji>grid</kanji> you see some people come out and overhear them talk about their mass <reading>maths</reading> (<ja>ます</ja>) tournament happening later today. Oohhh it IS a giant grid. And they're going to use it to do maths later!
readingInfo: You can make a grid out of anything if you set your mind to it. And you can do math anywhere as long as you have some grid paper!
